 What KFC sandwich uses fried chicken fillets in place of bread?

 ArcelorMittel Orbit is a sculpture and observation tower in the Olympic Park in Stratford, London. The sculpture is 115 metres (377 ft) tall, making it the tallest sculpture in the United Kingdom, and is a permanent legacy of London's hosting of the 2012 Summer Olympics. It was designed by Anish Kapoor and Cecil Balmond of engineering group Arup.

 Which country has a Formula One Grand Prix Circuit named 'Gilles Villeneuve'?

It was named in honor of Canadian Formula One driver Gilles Villeneuve, father of Jacques Villeneuve. The circuit has been home to the Canadian Grand Prix since 1978, when it replaced Mosport Park.

 Fotheringhay Castle is in which English county? 

 Fotheringhay Castle is a ruined castle in Fotheringhay, Northamptonshire, England. It was built in the 1130s by Simon de Senlis, Earl of Northampton. In 1460, it was the scene of the trial and execution of Richard of York, Duke of York, and in 1485, it was the scene of the trial and execution of King Richard III. The castle was abandoned in the 16th century and became a ruin.

 The Prince and the Pauper is an 1881 historical novel by American author Mark Twain. It tells the story of two young boys who are identical in appearance: Tom Canty, a pauper who lives with his abusive father in Offal Court off Pudding Lane in London, and Edward, Prince of Wales, who is heir to the English throne.

 Breaking Bad is an American television drama series created and produced by Vince Gilligan. The show originally aired on the AMC network for five seasons, from January 20, 2008, to September 29, 2013. The main character is Walter White (Bryan Cranston), a high school chemistry teacher who turns to making and selling crystal meth after being diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer. The title comes from the Southern colloquialism "breaking bad", meaning to "raise hell" or turn to a life of crime.

 What word, which is a type of protective helmet and part of citrus fruit, originally referred to the stem marrow of plants, and now refers figuratively to the core of a subject or argument? 

 Pith, also called medulla, is a tissue in the stems of vascular plants. The pith is composed of soft, spongy parenchyma cells which store and transport nutrients throughout the plant. Pith is located in the center of the stem, surrounded by the xylem tissue. The xylem tissue transports water and dissolved minerals from the roots throughout the plant. The phloem tissue, located on the outside of the xylem, transports sugars and other organic molecules made by the plant.

 The largest moon of Neptune is Triton. It was discovered by William Lassell on October 10, 1846, just 17 days after the discovery of Neptune. Triton is the only large moon in the solar system with a retrograde orbit, an orbit in the direction opposite to the planet's rotation.

 The Atlas Mountains are a mountain range in the Maghreb. They extend about 2,500 km (1,600 mi) through Morocco, Algeria, and Tunisia, and are the largest mountain range in Africa. The highest peak is Mount Toubkal, with an elevation of 4,167 metres (13,671 ft) in southwestern Morocco. The Atlas mountains are primarily inhabited by Berber people. The terms for 'mountain' in some Berber languages are adrar and adras, which are believed to be cognates of the toponym Atlas.

The adult has brown upperparts, with a blackish-brown stripe on the back, and greyish-brown underparts. The head is grey, with a black stripe running from the bill to the eye.
